en.purpose: To assess whether the combination of recorded major and minor criteria meets the threshold for diagnosing Polycythemia Vera according to the WHO guidelines.
en.use:
To be used in patients with suspected PV to determine whether the overall WHO criteria for PV diagnosis are met or not met. 
Requires meeting EITHER:
All three Major Criteria
OR
Two Major Criteria AND the Minor Criterion.
The guideline outputs a determination of
en.misuse: Not used to provide the final diagnosis, only determines if the criteria are formally met based on the inputs. Clinical correlation is still required.

other_details.en: Evaluates recorded findings against the World Health Organization diagnostic criteria to determine if the criteria for Polycythemia Vera (PV) are met.

allowed_values: local::at0004|Does not meet WHO diagnostic criteria for polycythemia vera.|
local::at0005|Meets WHO diagnostic criteria for polycythemia vera.|

default_actions: $gt0034|Diagnostic result|=local::at0004|Does not meet WHO diagnostic criteria for polycythemia vera.|

when: ($gt0003|Hemoglobin >16.5 g/dL in men or >16.0 g/dL in women, or hematocrit >49% in men or >48% in women|==local::at0007|Yes|&&$gt0004|Bone marrow biopsy showing age-adjusted hypercellularity with trilineage growth (panmyelosis), including prominent erythroid, granulocytic, and megakaryocytic proliferation, with pleomorphic, mature megakaryocytes (differences in size)|==local::at0012|Yes|&&$gt0005|Presence of JAK2 V617F or JAK2 exon 12 mutation|==local::at0014|Yes|)||($gt0003|Hemoglobin >16.5 g/dL in men or >16.0 g/dL in women, or hematocrit >49% in men or >48% in women|==local::at0007|Yes|&&$gt0004|Bone marrow biopsy showing age-adjusted hypercellularity with trilineage growth (panmyelosis), including prominent erythroid, granulocytic, and megakaryocytic proliferation, with pleomorphic, mature megakaryocytes (differences in size)|==local::at0012|Yes|&&$gt0006|Subnormal serum erythropoietin level|==local::at0016|Yes|)
then: $gt0034|Diagnostic result|=local::at0005|Meets WHO diagnostic criteria for polycythemia vera.|

gt0001.text: WHO Diagnostic Criteria for Polycythemia Vera
gt0001.description: Evaluates recorded findings against the World Health Organization diagnostic criteria to determine if the criteria for Polycythemia Vera (PV) are met.

gt0003.text: Hemoglobin >16.5 g/dL in men or >16.0 g/dL in women, or hematocrit >49% in men or >48% in women

gt0004.text: Bone marrow biopsy showing age-adjusted hypercellularity with trilineage growth (panmyelosis), including prominent erythroid, granulocytic, and megakaryocytic proliferation, with pleomorphic, mature megakaryocytes (differences in size)

gt0005.text: Presence of JAK2 V617F or JAK2 exon 12 mutation

gt0009.description: All three major criteria must be met, or the first two major criteria and the minor criterion should be met
